clues: This character first appeared in a film released before 1985.
This character is not a superhero.
This character does not appear in a science-fiction film.
This character is portrayed as an academic or intellectual profession.
This character is known for wearing a distinctive hat.
explanation: Indiana Jones debuted in Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981). He’s an archaeologist-adventurer, not a superhero, and not a sci-fi character.

clues: This city has a medieval Old Town and a Georgian New Town.
This city is dominated by a castle built on a volcanic rock.
This city hosts a world-famous arts festival every summer.
This city’s main street is called the Royal Mile.
This city is the capital of Scotland.
explanation: Edinburgh is Scotland’s capital city, famous for its castle, historic Old Town, Royal Mile, and annual international arts festivals.

clues: This item can invert under the right conditions.
This item is often shared reluctantly.
This item is commonly forgotten in public places.
This item is designed to protect you from the weather.
This item is opened above your head when it rains.
explanation: An umbrella is used for protection from rain, is often forgotten, and can turn inside out in strong winds.

clues: This structure was once widely criticised after it was built.
This structure was originally intended to be temporary.
This structure was constructed for a world exhibition.
This structure is located in a European capital city.
This structure is the most famous landmark in Paris.
explanation: The Eiffel Tower was built for the 1889 World’s Fair, initially disliked, and is now Paris’s most iconic landmark.

clues: This city has a castle located in its city centre.
This city lies close to the Bristol Channel.
This city is home to the Welsh Senedd.
This city has hosted international rugby matches.
This city is the capital of Wales.
explanation: Cardiff is the capital of Wales, featuring Cardiff Castle in the city centre and serving as the home of the Welsh Parliament.

clues: This country has no standing army.
This country sits on both a volcanic and a tectonic hotspot.
This country has more sheep than people.
This country is known for geysers and hot springs.
This country’s capital is Reykjavík.
explanation: Iceland is a volcanic island nation with geothermal activity, a small population, and no standing army.

clues: This character is strongly associated with logical deduction.
This character is frequently accompanied by a close associate.
This character is linked to a specific London address.
This character is a consulting detective.
This character famously lived at 221B Baker Street.
explanation: Sherlock Holmes is a fictional detective known for logical reasoning and his address at 221B Baker Street, London.

clues: This object often has duplicates made.
This object is frequently lost.
This object is usually carried rather than displayed.
This object is used to gain access.
This object is inserted into a lock.
explanation: A key is used to open locks, is commonly carried, frequently lost, and often has duplicates.

clues: This city is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
This city features Georgian architecture such as the Royal Crescent.
This city is famous for its Roman-built baths.
This city is located in Somerset.
This city’s name is directly linked to bathing.
explanation: Bath is a UNESCO-listed city in Somerset, best known for its Roman baths and Georgian landmarks like the Royal Crescent.

clues: This country consists of thousands of islands.
This country has one of the world’s oldest continuous monarchies.
This country is located in East Asia.
This country’s capital is Tokyo.
This country is commonly referred to as the Land of the Rising Sun.
explanation: Japan is an island nation in East Asia, home to Tokyo and one of the world’s oldest monarchies.

clues: This site was formed primarily by erosion.
This site is located in the western United States.
This site was carved by a river over millions of years.
This site is located in Arizona.
This site is one of the largest canyons in the world.
explanation: The Grand Canyon was carved by the Colorado River and is one of the most famous natural landmarks in the USA.

clues: This location has no permanent human population.
This location is not situated on a landmass.
This location experiences months of continuous daylight or darkness.
This location is associated with extreme cold.
This location is traditionally said to be home to Santa Claus.
explanation: The North Pole lies in the Arctic Ocean, has no permanent population, and is traditionally linked with Santa Claus.

clues: This item is traditionally brought indoors for a short period.
This item is commonly decorated rather than used.
This item often has lights added to it.
This item is associated with gifts underneath it.
This item is central to Christmas celebrations.
explanation: A Christmas tree is decorated with lights and ornaments and traditionally has gifts placed beneath it.

clues: This city played a key role in the Industrial Revolution.
This city has two world-famous football clubs.
This city was historically associated with the textile industry.
This city has an international airport.
This city is located in Greater Manchester.
explanation: Manchester was a major centre of the Industrial Revolution and is globally known for its football clubs and cultural influence.

clues: This item is often replaced annually.
This item is organised into months.
This item helps track dates rather than time of day.
This item commonly hangs on a wall.
This item shows the days of the year.
explanation: A calendar displays days and months of the year and is typically replaced annually.

clues: This person emigrated from Europe to the United States.
This person won a Nobel Prize in Physics.
This person is strongly associated with theoretical physics.
This person developed the theory of relativity.
This person is famously linked to the equation E=mc².
explanation: Albert Einstein was a theoretical physicist best known for developing the theory of relativity and the equation E=mc².

clues: This place spans multiple countries.
This place is primarily defined by its climate.
This place is located in Africa.
This place is the largest hot desert on Earth.
This place is known as the Sahara.
explanation: The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world and stretches across much of North Africa.

clues: This object reverses left and right but not up and down.
This object shows something without storing it.
This object is often found in bathrooms and bedrooms.
This object reflects light.
This object shows your own image.
explanation: A mirror reflects light to show your image, reversing left and right without recording anything.

clues: This occasion is associated with countdowns.
This occasion marks the end of a calendar year.
This occasion is celebrated worldwide.
This occasion occurs on 31 December.
This occasion immediately precedes New Year’s Day.
explanation: New Year’s Eve is celebrated on 31 December and marks the transition into a new calendar year.

clues: This country is both a nation and a continent.
This country is located entirely in the Southern Hemisphere.
This country has a capital city that is not its largest city.
This country is famous for unique wildlife such as kangaroos.
This country’s capital is Canberra.
explanation: Australia is both a country and a continent, known for its unique wildlife and capital city Canberra.

clues: This city was founded by the Romans.
This city has well-preserved medieval city walls.
This city contains a large Gothic cathedral known as a Minster.
This city is located in North Yorkshire.
This city’s streets include the Shambles.
explanation: York is a historic city in North Yorkshire, founded by the Romans and famous for York Minster and its medieval streets.

clues: This item is issued by a government.
This item contains personal identification details.
This item is commonly stamped.
This item is required for international travel.
This item proves your nationality.
explanation: A passport is an official government document used to identify a person and allow international travel.

clues: This place lies on a border between two countries.
This place is part of a major mountain range.
This place attracts climbers from around the world.
This place is the highest point on Earth.
This place is known as Mount Everest.
explanation: Mount Everest is the highest mountain on Earth and lies on the border between Nepal and China.

clues: This system is finite rather than infinite.
This system is ordered.
This system is used to build words.
This system consists of letters.
This system is known as the alphabet.
explanation: The alphabet is an ordered, finite set of letters used to form words and language.

clues: This person lived during the late 16th and early 17th centuries.
This person wrote works still performed today.
This person is associated with the Globe Theatre.
This person wrote plays and sonnets.
This person is William Shakespeare.
explanation: William Shakespeare was an English playwright and poet whose works remain widely performed and studied.

clues: This place spans more than one country.
This place plays a major role in Earth’s climate system.
This place contains immense biodiversity.
This place is located in South America.
This place is the Amazon Rainforest.
explanation: The Amazon Rainforest spans multiple South American countries and is known for its biodiversity and climate importance.

clues: This item is often associated with superstition.
This item is typically leaned rather than fixed.
This item is made up of evenly spaced sections.
This item is used to reach higher places.
This item is known as a ladder.
explanation: A ladder is leaned to climb upwards, consists of rungs, and is famously linked to the superstition of walking underneath it.

clues: This country has a famously recognisable shape.
This country was once the centre of a major ancient empire.
This country contains an independent city-state within its borders.
This country is known for pizza and pasta.
This country’s capital is Rome.
explanation: Italy is a European country shaped like a boot, home to Rome, and famous for its food and Roman history.

clues: This item is replaced more often than people realise.
This item is usually kept near a sink.
This item is used daily by most people.
This item is used for oral hygiene.
This item is a toothbrush.

clues: This structure was built primarily for defence.
This structure stretches for thousands of miles.
This structure was constructed over many centuries.
This structure is located in Asia.
This structure is the Great Wall of China.
explanation: The Great Wall of China is a vast defensive structure built over centuries and stretching thousands of miles.

clues: This concept acts on all objects with mass.
This concept was famously described by Isaac Newton.
This concept keeps planets in orbit.
This concept causes objects to fall.
This concept is gravity.
explanation: Gravity is the force that attracts objects with mass and causes them to fall toward one another.

clues: This person was involved in a historic space mission.
This person was part of NASA’s Apollo programme.
This person set foot on the Moon.

explanation: Neil Armstrong was the first person to walk on the Moon during the Apollo 11 mission.

clues: This body of water borders more than one continent.

This body of water covers more surface area than any other.

explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth and contains the Mariana Trench, the planet’s deepest point.

clues: This item is often sealed before use.
This item usually contains something flat.
This item is designed to be opened once.
This item is commonly sent through the post.
This item is an envelope.
explanation: An envelope is sealed to send flat items like letters through the post.

clues: This country is strongly associated with an ancient civilisation.
This country lies in both Africa and Asia.
This country is closely linked to a major river.
This country is famous for pyramids.
This country is Egypt.
explanation: Egypt is home to one of the world’s oldest civilisations and is famous for the Nile River and pyramids.

clues: This describes events that appear related but are not planned.
This is often surprising when it happens.
This is sometimes mistaken for fate.
This refers to things occurring at the same time by chance.
This is a coincidence.
explanation: A coincidence occurs when events align unexpectedly without deliberate planning.

clues: This structure is famous for an unintended feature.
This structure began leaning shortly after construction.
This structure is located in Europe.
This structure stands in Italy.

clues: This item does not use ink.
This item can be erased.

This item is commonly used for writing or drawing.

clues: This person had interests beyond their main profession.
This person lived during the Renaissance.
This person made significant contributions to both art and science.
This person painted the Mona Lisa.
This person was Leonardo da Vinci.
explanation: Leonardo da Vinci was a Renaissance polymath known for masterpieces like the Mona Lisa and wide-ranging scientific studies.

clues: This object has no atmosphere suitable for life.

This object orbits our planet.
This object has been visited by humans.

clues: This item is commonly checked or carried.
This item is associated with journeys.
This item often has wheels.

clues: This country is the largest in its continent by area.
This country’s official language is Portuguese.
This country contains most of the Amazon Rainforest.
This country is famous for Carnival.

clues: This city is a seaside resort on the south coast of England.
This city has a long pier extending into the sea.
This city is known for its pebble beach.
This city lies in East Sussex.

explanation: Brighton is a seaside city in East Sussex, known for its pier, pebble beach, and distinctive Regency architecture.

clues: This concept varies depending on location.
This concept affects what time it is around the world.
This concept is based on Earth’s rotation.
This concept divides the globe longitudinally.

clues: This landmark lies on an international border.
This landmark is composed of multiple waterfalls.
This landmark is located in North America.
This landmark sits between the United States and Canada.
This landmark is Niagara Falls.

clues: This instrument measures a physical property.

This instrument measures degrees.
This instrument measures temperature.

This person achieved a record-breaking solo journey.
This person disappeared during a flight.
This person was a pioneering female pilot.
This person was Amelia Earhart.

clues: This mountain is considered sacred.

This mountain is located in Asia.
This mountain is found in Japan.

explanation: Mount Fuji is a sacred stratovolcano in Japan and one of the country’s most recognisable landmarks.

This object is designed for precision rather than force.

clues: This body of water borders multiple continents.

This body of water lies between Europe and Africa.
